arrayLength = []
def lenCheck(arrayX):
    for x in arrayX:
        arrayLength.append(len(x))
lenCheck(arrayCheck)
arrayLength

for col in ['parks', 'playgrounds', 'sports', 'roading']:
    public[col] = public[col].astype('category')

df['year'] = df['date'].dt.year
df['month'] = df['date'].dt.month
df['day'] = df['date'].dt.day
df['hour'] = df['date'].dt.hour
df['minute'] = df['date'].dt.minute

import datetime as dt

testEnd = dt.datetime(2003,3,27,7,0,0)
testStart = dt.datetime(2003,3,27,6,0,0)
testTimeFrame = dt.timedelta(hours = 1)

def eventPR(ds, eventAStart, periodStart, periodEnd, dayType, eventB, timeFrame):
    tempDF = ds[(ds.start < periodEnd + timeFrame) & (ds.start > periodStart)]
    return tempDF
    
dsNew = eventPR(ds, 0, testStart, testEnd, 0, 0, testTimeFrame)



import datetime as dt

def nearest_neighbours(events, n=1, delta_threshold=dt.timedelta(-99)):
    nns = []
    for row in events.itertuples():
        #print(row)
        start_time = getattr(row, 'start')
        end_time = getattr(row, 'end')
        subActNum = getattr(row, 'subActNum')
        #print(subActNum)
        row_index = getattr(row, 'Index')
        nn = events[(events.start >= start_time) & (events.index != row_index) & (end_time - events.start > delta_threshold)][:n]
        ordered = pd.DataFrame()
        ordered['EventA'] = subActNum
        #print(ordered['EventA'])
        ordered['EventB'] = nn['subActNum']
        ordered['EvA_Start'] = start_time
        ordered['EvA_End'] = end_time
        ordered['EvB_Start'] = nn['start']
        ordered['EvB_End'] = nn['end']
        nns.append(ordered)
  
    #print(nns)
    return pd.concat(nns)

def id_delta(events):
    df = events.copy()
    return df

#id_delta(ds).head()
nearest_neighbours(ds, 5, dt.timedelta(0,-10))


## Importing R Plotting Capabilities
# https://medium.com/@crscardellino/python-with-ggplot-9ed888af93ca
#import pandas as pd
# import rpy2
# the base of rpy2 plotting is matplotlib, thus we need to declare
# it inline in order to see the plots in the notebook
# %matplotlib inline
#from rpy2.robjects import pandas2ri # we need to activate the automatic conversion for pandas
#pandas2ri.activate()
#%load_ext rpy2.ipython
# load the needed extension for the %%R cell magic


# get min/max
initialTimeStart = min(ds.start)
finalTimeStart = max(ds.start)
print("Initial Time for START:", initialTimeStart, '\n' "Final Time for START:", finalTimeStart)

# get min/max
initialTimeEnd = min(ds.end)
finalTimeEnd = max(ds.end)
print("Initial Time for END:", initialTimeStart, '\n' "Final Time for END:", finalTimeStart)
